data.title: Color addition
data.statement:
RGB colors can be represented as a single integer. 

A color channel holds the value for a single color, usually 8 bits long. For RGB colors, the first 8 bits represent the red channel, the 8 bits after that the green channel, and the last 8 bits the blue channel. Here we will interpret the sequence of three channels as a single 24 bit number.

The easiest way to get the sum of two colors is to find the sum of each color channel. If the sum in any channel is greater than 255, use 255 instead. For two given integers representing RGB colors, extract the values of their color channels, and output their sum.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

RGB colors can be represented as a single integer.

A color channel holds the value for a single color, usually 8 bits long. For RGB colors, the first 8 bits represent the red channel, the 8 bits after that the green channel, and the last 8 bits the blue channel. Here we will interpret the sequence of three channels as a single 24 bit number.

The easiest way to get the sum of two colors is to find the sum of each color channel. If the sum in any channel is greater than 255, use 255 instead. For two given integers representing RGB colors, extract the values of their color channels, and output their sum.
Input
Line 1: An integer Col1 The first color.
Line 2: An integer Col2 The second color.
Output
3 space-separated integers R G B
Constraints
0 ≤ Col1 < 2^24
0 ≤ Col2 < 2^24
0 ≤ R ≤ 255
0 ≤ G ≤ 255
0 ≤ B ≤ 255
Example
Input
255
0
Output
0 0 255
